title: Fix white-screen by mounting TanStack Router from App and adding a render error fallback

requirements.text: Replace the placeholder `App` component (currently returning `null`) with a real application shell that mounts TanStack Router using the existing `routeTree` so the site loads and routes render (Home, Menu, About, Contact, Signup, Checkout). This must be implemented without editing `frontend/src/main.tsx` (immutable) by making `frontend/src/App.tsx` render the router.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the deployed site no longer shows a blank/white screen.
`frontend/src/main.tsx` continues to render `<App />`, and `App` now renders the TanStack Router provider wired to `frontend/src/routeTree.tsx`.
Direct navigation to `/`, `/menu`, `/about`, `/contact`, `/signup`, and `/checkout` renders the corresponding page content.

requirements.text: Add a minimal, user-friendly runtime fallback so that if the frontend throws during initial render (including router initialization), users see an English error message with a refresh instruction instead of a blank screen.
acceptanceCriteria: If an error occurs during initial render, the UI displays an English message indicating something went wrong and instructing the user to refresh the page.
The fallback renders instead of a blank/white screen.

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only components).

Do not edit immutable paths, including `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, and `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`. Implement the fix by changing non-immutable files such as `frontend/src/App.tsx`.
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for this fix.
nonGoals: Adding new pages or changing the existing route structure beyond wiring up the already-defined `routeTree`.
Implementing new backend methods or persistence.
Changing branding, menu data, checkout behavior, or site configuration as part of this fix.
